kpis.title: Incidents by Body Part Affected (Book4 Data)

safetyMetrics.title: OSHA Recordable Rate
safetyMetrics.description: CRITICAL: 46.15% of all incidents (6 of 13) are OSHA Recordable. This is 9x ABOVE industry standard. Indicates serious workplace injuries that must be reported to OSHA.
safetyMetrics.recommendation: URGENT ACTION REQUIRED: Implement comprehensive safety improvements across all workstreams, with particular focus on Manual Material Handling where 50% of incidents are OSHA Recordable.

safetyMetrics.title: Manual Material Handling Dominance
safetyMetrics.description: Manual Material Handling accounts for 10 of 13 incidents (76.92%). This single workstream represents nearly 4x the safe industry threshold. Risk Score: 500 (CRITICAL). OSHA Rate in this workstream: 50%.
safetyMetrics.recommendation: CRITICAL PRIORITY: Ergonomic assessment of all material handling tasks. Implement lifting aids, proper technique training, workstation redesign, and job rotation. This is the #1 root cause of injuries.

safetyMetrics.title: Wrist Injury Risk - HIGHEST SEVERITY
safetyMetrics.description: All wrist injuries (2 incidents) are OSHA Recordable (100% severity). Risk Score: 200 (CRITICAL). While only 15% of total incidents, the severity of wrist injuries is extreme. Both are related to Manual Material Handling.
safetyMetrics.recommendation: HIGH PRIORITY: Immediate review of manual handling techniques and tools. Provide wrist supports, consider task redesign, implement anti-fatigue protocols, and mandatory wrist protection when handling.

safetyMetrics.title: Shoulder Injury Rate - Most Frequent
safetyMetrics.description: Shoulder is the most frequently injured body part (4 incidents, 30.77%). Risk Score: 100 (HIGH). Pattern suggests cumulative/repetitive strain from lifting and carrying. 3 are non-medical, 1 is OSHA Recordable (25% severity rate for shoulders).
safetyMetrics.recommendation: PRIORITY 2: Implement shoulder-focused ergonomics program. Introduce mechanical lifting aids, rotate workers to reduce repetitive strain, add stretching/strengthening exercises to wellness programs, and modify work surfaces to minimize overhead reaching.

safetyMetrics.title: Hand Tools/Equipment Risk - MAXIMUM SEVERITY
safetyMetrics.description: The single Hand Tools/Equipment incident (1 incident) is 100% OSHA Recordable. While small sample size, the severity rate is maximum. This suggests tool-related hazards are inherently dangerous when they occur.
safetyMetrics.recommendation: URGENT: Comprehensive tool safety audit. Evaluate all hand tools for ergonomic design, consider tool guards/protective equipment, implement mandatory tool inspection protocols, and provide specialized hand tool training.

safetyMetrics.title: Facial Injury Risk - Moderate Concern
safetyMetrics.description: Face injuries (Eyes + Nose = 3 incidents, 23.07% of total). Eyes: 50% OSHA rate (1 of 2), Nose: 0% OSHA rate. Risk Score: 100 (HIGH). All facial injuries occur in Manual Material Handling workstream. Pattern suggests flying debris or impact hazards.
safetyMetrics.recommendation: PRIORITY 3: Implement mandatory facial PPE in Manual Material Handling areas. Regular PPE compliance audits, eye protection fit-testing, and assessment of material movement to prevent flying hazards. Emphasize why eye protection saves vision.

priorityActions.title: PHASE 1: Comprehensive Manual Material Handling Audit & Redesign
priorityActions.description: 10 incidents (76.92%) in this category with 50% OSHA Recordable rate represents unacceptable risk level. Required Actions: (1) Immediate ergonomic assessment of all packing lane stations (129, 76) and decasing stations using professional ergonomist; (2) Assess each task for load weight, distance, frequency, awkward postures; (3) Evaluate current lifting aids and equipment effectiveness; (4) Design engineering controls (mechanical assists, conveyor modifications, workstation height adjustments); (5) Implement best practices from industry standards.
priorityActions.owner: Safety Director + Operations Manager + Occupational Health Specialist
priorityActions.metrics: Week 1: Audit complete. Week 4: First interventions deployed. Target: Reduce to 5 incidents, decrease OSHA rate to 20%

priorityActions.title: PHASE 2: Mandatory Safety Training - Material Handling & Ergonomics
priorityActions.description: All associates in Footwear department must complete comprehensive training: (1) Proper lifting technique (bend knees, keep load close, test weight first); (2) Use of mechanical lifting aids; (3) Task analysis and load assessment; (4) Reporting unsafe conditions; (5) Stretching and body mechanics for injury prevention. Training must be hands-on, in-station, with supervisor competency checks. Include data from this incident analysis to show real consequences.
priorityActions.timeline: Complete by end of Week 2 (all shifts)
priorityActions.metrics: 100% attendance + competency certification. Pre/post assessment scores >85%. Monthly refreshers.

priorityActions.title: PHASE 3: Wrist Safety - Tool Review & Hand Protection Program
priorityActions.description: Wrist injuries show 100% OSHA Recordable severity (2 incidents). This indicates tool hazards are extremely serious when they occur. Required: (1) Audit all hand tools used in Manual Material Handling; (2) Evaluate for ergonomic design, vibration, repetitive stress hazards; (3) Implement mandatory wrist supports/braces for high-risk tasks; (4) Provide anti-vibration gloves for power tools; (5) Limit repetitive wrist motions via job rotation; (6) Education on early signs of carpal tunnel and RSI.
priorityActions.timeline: Week 1: Tool audit | Week 2: PPE procurement | Week 3: Implementation
priorityActions.metrics: Zero wrist injuries going forward. 100% PPE compliance. Monthly ergonomic assessments.

priorityActions.title: PHASE 4: Shoulder Injury Prevention - Multi-Modal Approach
priorityActions.description: Shoulder injuries are the #1 location (30.77%, 4 incidents). Pattern indicates repetitive/cumulative strain from lifting/carrying in material handling. Strategy: (1) Implement 20-minute stretching/movement breaks every 2 hours; (2) Provide shoulder-focused ergonomic equipment (load carriers, mechanical assists); (3) Job rotation to vary shoulder-loading tasks; (4) Strength/stability training in wellness program; (5) Monitor associates with prior shoulder issues; (6) Modify workstations to reduce reaching distance.
priorityActions.timeline: Stretching program: Start immediately | Equipment: Weeks 2-3 | Wellness integration: Week 4
priorityActions.metrics: 4 incidents â†’ <1 per month. Shoulder pain reports decrease by 50%. 90% participation in stretching program.

priorityActions.title: PHASE 5: Eye & Face Protection Mandate in Material Handling
priorityActions.description: Face injuries (3 incidents: 2 eyes, 1 nose) suggest flying debris or impact hazards during material handling. 50% are OSHA Recordable. Required: (1) Mandatory full-face protective equipment for packing and decasing operations; (2) Anti-fog, anti-scratch safety glasses minimum; (3) Face shields for high-hazard stations; (4) Monthly PPE compliance audits; (5) Education on why eye protection is critical.
priorityActions.timeline: Week 1: Implement mandate with training | Ongoing: Monthly audits
priorityActions.metrics: Zero face injuries going forward. 100% PPE compliance on first observation. Maintain monthly.

priorityActions.title: Establish Incident Monitoring & Trending System
priorityActions.description: Current analysis shows 13 incidents over an unspecified period. Must establish: (1) Daily incident tracking with real-time reporting; (2) Weekly safety metrics reviews; (3) Monthly trend analysis; (4) Root cause investigation for all incidents; (5) Corrective action tracking; (6) Associate near-miss reporting culture; (7) Dashboard for leadership visibility. Use this dashboard as the centerpiece for tracking progress.
priorityActions.timeline: System ready by end of Week 1, data entry begins immediately
priorityActions.metrics: Daily tracking started. Weekly metrics reports. 100% root cause investigations. Corrective actions closed >90%.
